info.title: IT Collect
info.description:
The IT Dashboard team aims to build a modern API that acts as the center-piece of a modular IT data reporting ecosystem. This OpenAPI spec shows the initial direction of ITCollect data architecture and is aimed at providing real-time updates to the IT Collect API. It will serve as living documentation of the latest changes.

# Authentication

<!-- ReDoc-Inject: <security-definitions> -->

get.summary: Retrieves the collection of Products resources.

GetProductsItem.description: The `id` value returned in the response can be used as the `id` parameter in `GET /v1/auxiliary/systems/{system}/products/{id}`.

get.summary: Retrieves a Products resource.
Retrieves the collection of Services resources.

GetServicesItem.description: The `id` value returned in the response can be used as the `id` parameter in `GET /v1/services/{id}`.

get.summary: Retrieves a Services resource.
Retrieves the collection of Systems resources.

GetSystemsItem.description: The `id` value returned in the response can be used as the `id` parameter in `GET /v1/services/{service}/auxiliary/systems/{id}`.

get.summary: Retrieves a Systems resource.
Retrieves the collection of CioRating resources.

GetCioRatingItem.description: The `id` value returned in the response can be used as the `id` parameter in `GET /v1/services/{service}/cio-ratings/{id}`.

get.summary: Retrieves a CioRating resource.
Retrieves the collection of Contract resources.

GetContractItem.description: The `id` value returned in the response can be used as the `id` parameter in `GET /v1/services/{service}/contracts/{id}`.

get.summary: Retrieves a Contract resource.
Retrieves the collection of Ledger resources.

GetLedgerItem.description: The `id` value returned in the response can be used as the `id` parameter in `GET /v1/services/{service}/ledgers/{id}`.

get.summary: Retrieves a Ledger resource.
Retrieves the collection of Metric resources.

GetMetricItem.description: The `id` value returned in the response can be used as the `id` parameter in `GET /v1/services/{service}/metrics/{id}`.

get.summary: Retrieves a Metric resource.
Retrieves the collection of MetricActuals resources.

GetMetricActualsItem.description: The `id` value returned in the response can be used as the `id` parameter in `GET /v1/services/{service}/metrics/{metric}/actuals/{id}`.

get.summary: Retrieves a MetricActuals resource.
Retrieves the collection of Projects resources.

GetProjectsItem.description: The `id` value returned in the response can be used as the `id` parameter in `GET /v1/services/{service}/projects/{id}`.

get.summary: Retrieves a Projects resource.
Retrieves the collection of Activity resources.

GetActivityItem.description: The `id` value returned in the response can be used as the `id` parameter in `GET /v1/services/{service}/projects/{project}/activities/{id}`.

get.summary: Retrieves a Activity resource.

activityName.description: A short description consistent with the critical steps within the Agency project management methodology.

description.example: Allow relevant users to access CPIC data
description.description:
Brief description of primary goal/outcome the activity is planning to provide for the Investment upon
completion.

plannedStartDate.description: The planned start date (YYYY-MM-DD) for the activity. This is the baseline value.

plannedEndDate.description: The planned completion date (YYYY-MM-DD) for the activity. This is the baseline value.

projectedStartDate.description: If the activity has not yet started, enter the current projected start date (YYYY-MM-DD) of the activity.

projectedEndDate.description:
If the activity has not yet completed, enter the current planned completion date (YYYY-MM-DD)
of the activity.

actualStartDate.description: When the activity starts, enter the actual start date (YYYY-MM-DD) here.

actualEndDate.description: When the activity ends, enter the actual completion date (YYYY-MM-DD) here.

plannedTotalCost.description:
The planned total cost for the activity. This is the baseline value. [$M] Note: For programs that are
employing earned value management, Agencies should reflect "budget at completion" in the "Total Costs Planned"
Column 11 and "estimated at completion" in the "Total Costs Projected" Column 12.

actualTotalCost.description: When the activity ends, enter the total actual costs for the activity here.

projectedTotalCost.description:
When the activity is not yet completed, enter the current planned total cost of the activity. [$M]
Note: For programs that are employing earned value management, Agencies should reflect "budget at completion"
in the "Total Costs Planned" Column 11 and estimated at completion in the "Total Costs Projected" Column 12.

structureId.description:
Agency-specified identifier that indicates the work breakdown structure (WBS) the Agency uses to
associate the activity with other activities or a project. Provide this in the format of "x.x.x.x.x" where the
first string is the Unique Project ID and each following string (separated by periods) matches the structure ID
of a parent activity. See below for more guidance about parent and child activities expressed through this
structure. [x.x.x.x.x]

rating.description:
CIOs best judgment of the current level of risk for the Investment in terms of its ability
to accomplish its goals (per 40 U.S.C.  11315 (c)(2)).
1 represents the lowest possible score and 5 represent the highest possible score.

comment.example: CIO Evaluation Report on 10/1/2020 produced a score of 5.
comment.description: Explanation and/or additional details regarding this reported value

date.description: Provide the date of CIO Evaluation

PIID.description:
The unique identifier for each contract, agreement, or order associated with this
Investment (Federal Procurement Data Systems (FPDS) data element 1A).
Enter PIID numbers for contacts, agreements, or orders both that have already been awarded.
Completed and/or expired contracts do not need to be included.
Data definitions can be found at Federal Procurement Data System.
Please note that reference PIIDs should not be entered for this field.

referencePIID.description:
For each PIID number reported for contract support obtained via an order or call,
report the Reference PIID per FPDS instructions for element 1c.

costItem.description:
Optional descriptive name detailing the type of funding information provided within  given ledger
item

year.description: Fiscal year associated with the funding in a given ledger item

amount.description: Funding amount for a ledger item

type.description:
Select either O&M or DME.
O&M: Operations & Maintenance Costs refers to the expenses required to operate and maintain an IT asset that is operating in a production environment.
DME: Development, Modernization, and Enhancement refers to projects and activities leading to new IT assets/systems, as well as projects and activities that change or modify existing IT assets to substantively improve capability or performance, implement legislative or regulatory requirements, or meet an Agency leadership request. DME activity may occur at any time during a programs life cycle.

costPool.description:
For ledger items selecting TBM reporting, Agencies can align funding against a Cost Pool per the
definitions for TBM v3.0 provided online by the TBM Council

ITTower.description:
For ledger items selecting TBM reporting, Agencies can align funding against a IT Tower per the
definitions for TBM v3.0 provided online by the TBM Council

budgetYear.description:
For all ledger items, Agencies should indicate the budget reporting year associated with the
request. For example, submissions during the BY 2023 submission period that describe PY funding should use the
following data points: Budget Year of 2023 and Fiscal Year of 2021

fundingSource.description:
For ledger items selecting Funding Sources Reporting, indicate the Funding Source associated with a
given ledger item.

source.description:
For ledger items selecting Funding Sources Reporting, indicate whether the funding is associated
with 'Agency Funding' or 'Contributions'

ledgerElementStyle.description:
Indicate the type of funding data a given ledger request will provide to IT Collect. This field's
selection will trigger a series of validation checks to ensure that Agencies are providing and omitting the
relevant data points for either Funding Sources or TBM reporting. Funding Sources reporting will mandate the
inclusion of the Funding Source, Source, and Type fields. TBM reporting will mandate the inclusion of either
the Cost Pool or IT Tower field.

description.example: Percent of Time System is Available for End Users
description.description:
Description to help the user understand what is being measured. In this field, describe the units
used, any calculation algorithm used, and the definition or limits of the population or "universe" measured

performanceMeasurementCategory.description: Select the applicable performance measurement category

agencyPriorityGoalCode.description:
Each Investment must have at least one active metric in the Strategic and Business Results category
(of any reporting frequency) tied to the foremost Agency strategic objective (SO), or Agency priority goal (APG)
(as required by A-11 Section 230 and Section 250 respectively). Provide that code for the associated metric using
the appropriate alphanumeric identifier provided by performance.gov.

reportingFrequency.description:
How often actual measurements will be reported (monthly, quarterly, semi-annually, or annually).
Annual reporting frequencies are reserved for annual operating cost measures, performance measures associated
with the Agency's annual performance plan, or other measures that can only be appropriately measured on an annual
basis.

measurementCondition.description:
Indicates whether a desired result would be "over target," indicating that the trend should maintain
or increase, or "under target," indicating that the trend should maintain or decrease.

baselineCapability.description:
What was the quantitative value of your Agency's capability per this metric prior tothis Investment's
life cycle. If your Agency has not measured this capability before, you may leave this field blank; otherwise,
provide the numeric value of the historic capability measurement.

unitOfMeasure.description:
Brief indication of what quantity is measured (e.g., number, percentage, dollar value) for each
metric.

performanceMeasurementCategory.description: Select the applicable performance measurement category

system.description: Should contain the IRI or ID of a System in the Products Document

productName.description: Indicate the official product name (e.g., Enterprise Business Suite, Momentum, HCM).

versionNumber.description: Indicate the Product Name version number to at least the first minor version digit (e.g., 12.1, 9.2, etc.).

vendorName.description: Indicate the official vendor name (e.g., Oracle, SAP, CGI, GSA) for the specific product (i.e., non-integrated services).

lastMajorTechRefresh.description: Provide the date that the product last had a major refreshment, replacement, or addition of hardware or software (not patching).

anticipatedTechRefresh.description: Provide, if applicable, the anticipated date that the product will have its next major refreshment, replacement or addition of hardware or software (not patching).

productExpectEndOfLife.description:
If there is no planned end of life, enter N/A. End of Life represents the date on which the vendor
is no longer providing regular support (extended support for a software version for example is outside of the expected end of life)
for a solution, or the original manufacturer is no longer manufacturing parts.

productName.description: Indicate the official product name (e.g., Enterprise Business Suite, Momentum, HCM).

vendorName.description: Indicate the official vendor name (e.g., Oracle, SAP, CGI, GSA) for the specific product (i.e., non-integrated services).

versionNumber.description: Indicate the Product Name version number to at least the first minor version digit (e.g., 12.1, 9.2, etc.).

lastMajorTechRefresh.description: Provide the date that the product last had a major refreshment, replacement, or addition of hardware or software (not patching).

anticipatedTechRefresh.description: Provide, if applicable, the anticipated date that the product will have its next major refreshment, replacement or addition of hardware or software (not patching).

productExpectEndOfLife.description:
If there is no planned end of life, enter N/A. End of Life represents the date on which the vendor
is no longer providing regular support (extended support for a software version for example is outside of the expected end of life)
for a solution, or the original manufacturer is no longer manufacturing parts.

productName.description: Indicate the official product name (e.g., Enterprise Business Suite, Momentum, HCM).

vendorName.description: Indicate the official vendor name (e.g., Oracle, SAP, CGI, GSA) for the specific product (i.e., non-integrated services).

versionNumber.description: Indicate the Product Name version number to at least the first minor version digit (e.g., 12.1, 9.2, etc.).

lastMajorTechRefresh.description: Provide the date that the product last had a major refreshment, replacement, or addition of hardware or software (not patching).

anticipatedTechRefresh.description: Provide, if applicable, the anticipated date that the product will have its next major refreshment, replacement or addition of hardware or software (not patching).

for a solution, or the original manufacturer is no longer manufacturing parts.

projectId.description: An Agency-specified alphanumeric code that uniquely identifies the project within the Investment.

projectName.description: Name used by the Agency to refer specifically to the project.

projectGoal.example: Develop a mechanism to collect CPIC data'
projectGoal.description: Brief description of primary goal/outcome the project is planning to provide for the Investment upon completion.

startDate.description:
Planned start date of in-progress projects or planned start of projects that have not yet begun
(may be before the current FY or activities listed in Table C.2). [MM-DD-YYYY]

endDate.description:
Planned date of completion of in-progress projects or actual completion date of projects that have been
completed (may be after BY or completion date of activities listed in activities Table C.2). [MM-DD-YYYY]

totalCost.description:
The planned total cost for the activity. This is the baseline value. [$M]  Note: For programs that are employing earned value management, Agencies should
reflect "budget at completion" in the "Total Costs Planned" Column 11 and "estimated at completion" in the "Total Costs Projected" Column 12.

currentUii.description:
The Current UII includes an Agency code and a nine-digit unique identifier.
Variable information formerly included in the UII of previous years is not part
of the UII primary key.

budgetYear.description: The budget year for the investment.

title.description:
This is a text field to provide the Investment title. To the extent that they are not
part of the name used by the Agency, other identifiers such as bureaus or other
numeric codes should not be included as part of an Investment title.

description.example: Sample description of the IT Dashboard modernization process.
description.description:
Description for each Investment. This description should briefly explain the
purpose of the Investment and what program(s) it supports, including the value
to the public.

changeInStatus.description:
This is used when an Investment has a change in status (e.g., downgraded to non-major IT Investment,
eliminated, retired, consolidated, split) for the current budget submission relative to the previous budget
cycle. The change of status should be indicated with one of the following reasons:

changeInStatusDescription.description:
This is used when an indicator has been chosen for "Change in Investment Status Identifier" in
order to provide a description of the rationale for the change, which may include impacted UIIs, specific
references to legislative requirements, or governance board decisions and effective dates.

systemName.description: Agency internal name for system or sub-system, as applicable (e.g., Delphi, HUDCaps, AGMAX, etc.).

suic.description:
The System Unique Identifier Code (SUIC) includes an Agency code and ane leven-digit unique identifier.
XXX- xxxxxxx- xxxx: The first three digits represent your Agency code (see Appendix C of OMB Circular No. A-11).
xxx- XXXXXXX- xxxx: The next seven digits serve as the systems unique identifier.
xxx- xxxxxxx- XXXX: The last four digits serve as the sub-systems unique identifier.
This identifier should be system-generated and applied at the Agency level. [14- digit primary key for all systems]

systemFunctions.description:
For administrative and mission support systems, provide all relevant service area
functions associated with this system as defined by the Federal Integrated Business Framework (FIBF), e.g., FFM.010 as applicable. [7 digit code for each function or N/A]

customDeveloped.description:
Indicate whether all components of the system were entirely custom developed within Government and do
not contain any purchased products (e.g., commercial- off-the-shelf software, licensing, etc.). [Yes/No]

initialOperatingYear.description: The fiscal year in which the system was first deployed.

relatedUiis.description:
Provide all UIIs submitted to the Services endpoint that are associated with a given system.
This field establishes the linkage between UIIs and systems.

systemName.description: Agency internal name for system or sub-system, as applicable (e.g., Delphi, HUDCaps, AGMAX, etc.).

suic.description:
The System Unique Identifier Code (SUIC) includes an Agency code and ane leven-digit unique identifier.
XXX- xxxxxxx- xxxx: The first three digits represent your Agency code (see Appendix C of OMB Circular No. A-11).
xxx- XXXXXXX- xxxx: The next seven digits serve as the systems unique identifier.
xxx- xxxxxxx- XXXX: The last four digits serve as the sub-systems unique identifier.

initialOperatingYear.description: The fiscal year in which the system was first deployed.

relatedUiis.description:
Provide all UIIs submitted to the Services endpoint that are associated with a given system.
This field establishes the linkage between UIIs and systems.

products.description:
This is a child table of System - Report the following data (Products fields) for every product
(e.g., application software, middleware software, reporting products, servers, etc.) of each system and sub-system
reported in Systems Table B.1 that indicated No in Column 5 Custom Developed. Systems and sub-systems may have
one or more products that should be reported individually rather than included within broader license agreements.

oauth.description:
IT Collect will utilize the OAuth2 Authorization framework to authenticate vendor client
applications to start using our APIs. A walkthrough of client configuration for Postman is
outlined below. All current documentation and application features are currently undergoing
development.

## Prerequisites
- Request an OAuth 2 identifer and secret from IT Collect team.
- Request a sandbox user account.

## Postman

[Postman](https://www.postman.com/) is an API Client that you can use for communication
with IT Collect

### Steps (without PIV card)

1. Create a new Postman Collection and import the openAPI spec

2. Edit the Collection

3. Switch to the Authorization tab and select `OAuth 2.0`

4. Click the "Get New Access Token" button leaving Header Prefix as `Bearer`.

| Setting | Value |
| ------------- | ------------- |
| Token Name | Bearer |
| Grant Type | Authorization Code |
| * Callback URL | https://app.getpostman.com/oauth2/callback |
| * Authorize using browser | *leave unchecked, see Steps (with PIV / Login.gov)* |
| Auth URL (TBD) | https://dev-itcollect-oauth.itcollect.domain/oauth/authorize |
| Access Token URL (TBD) | https://dev-itcollect-oauth.itcollect.domain.com/oauth/token |
| Client ID | *{Request from IT Collect}* |
| Client Secret | *{Request from IT Collect}* |
| Scope (TBD) |  |
| * State |  |
| Client Authentication | Send client credentials in body |

> * Callback URL: Vendor application callback URL.  Will depend on individual vendor
implementation.  Must be provided to IT Collect team prior to implementation.
> * State: This is an optional parameter, leave blank in Postman, but you may provide a
state in your vendor application. You may use this as CSRF protection mechanism or to
assist in maintaining a state such as a session key.

5. Click "Request Token"

6. Login using either your sandbox user account or your login.gov account.

You should now have an access token suitable for defining the HTTP Authorization Header.

### Steps (with Login.gov PIV card)

PIV (Personal Identity Verification) cards testing steps

1. Using the same steps as above enable the "Authorize using browser" checkbox. This should
change the `Callback URL` to `https://oauth.pstmn.io/v1/callback`.

2. Click "Request Token"

3. Once the browser window has opened (you may need to allow popups in your browse for this
domain) click "Login with Login.gov"

4. Provide your Login.gov credentials using either your PIV access card or username and
password credentials.

You should now have an access token suitable for defining in the HTTP Authorization Header.
